basics.name: Calvan Liang
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I recently graduated from University of Hawaii at Manoa with a B.S. in Computer Science in Spring 2021. I enjoy learning different aspects of computing technology. My focus is computer operation, management, and maintenance. I also have interest in web design, development, and management.

education.institution: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa, B.S. Computer Science

work.summary: Computer Lab Monitor for the Center for Language & Technology Computer Lab.
highlights: Provide lab users assistance in operating the computers and equipment.
Troubleshoot and resolve various computer-related issues, of which could be hardware-related or software-related.
Record number of users and their activities every hour.

volunteer.summary: RadGrad is a project that intends to improve and aid students in their STEM career path. It helps students and aspiring STEM specialists by guiding them through their degree program and presenting them post-graduate opportunities.
highlights: Part of the DevOps team for RadGrad

Research project for a better hosting platform for RadGrad. Variables for better include available application performance monitoring tools, performance, scalability, and minimal cost trade-off for performance

volunteer.summary: Cyber defense competition where an eight person team work to secure eight computers. We are the 'blue' side, who are working to defend against the attacking 'red' side.
highlights: Secure the computer from potential security threats under a time constraint.
Find solutions to various problems posed by the current scenario.

volunteer.summary: The 2020 Hawaii Annual Code Challenge (HACC) is a competition where participants use their knowledge, skills, and creativity to design a useful application that would benefit the people of Hawaii in some way.
highlights: My team and I created a mobile app called Helping Hands. Helping Hands is a Hawaii State Resource Directory Application.
It helps users who need assistance find resources or programs that can assist them with housing, food, and medical.

awards.title: 28th Annual Physics Olympics, 2017 Second Place Winner
awards.summary: A competition that tested students' knowledge of physics through various problems and activities. My team and I placed second.

references.name: Aki Kuwada, Secretary of the Center for Language & Technology,
